From Chrome 108, the following replaced elements respect the overflow property:¬†img,¬†video¬†and¬†canvas. In earlier versions of Chrome, this property was ignored on these elements.

articles.description:
The Media Queries Level 4 specification has introduced a new syntax for targeting a range of viewport widths using common mathematical comparison operators, like , and =, that make more sense syntactically while writing less code for responsive web design.

sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine ‚Äî For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Andrew Stetsenko)
articles.description: Working abroad is a popular prospect, yet many people ‚Äî including professionals in the tech sphere ‚Äî don‚Äôt know where to start. In this article, Andrew Stetsenko gives you an ultimate step-by-step guide to finding and making international opportunities happen.
articles.title: How To Search For A Developer Job Abroad

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Everything design systems on accessibility, enterprise design systems, Figma kits, data visualization, motion design, multi-lingual design, naming, ROI calculator and UX writing.
articles.title: Design Systems: Useful Examples and Resources

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Atila Fassina)
articles.description: Let‚Äôs talk about Next.js, one of the most well-known React frameworks used for production. From new components to font optimization, Atila shares a quick overview and invites you to join his [Advanced Next.js Masterclass](https://smashingconf.com/online-workshops/workshops/advanced-nextjs-atila-fassina) taking place later this month.
articles.title: What‚Äôs New In Next.js 13?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Siobhan McKeown)
articles.description: Transparency is part of the fabric of many remote businesses. It doesn‚Äôt, however, come naturally to everyone, especially if you‚Äôve only recently become remote. In this article, Siobhan takes you through some of the practical ways that you can build transparency within your organization.
articles.title: Practical Steps To Build Transparency In Your Remote Business

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Iris Lje≈°njanin)
articles.description: What‚Äôs the state of HTML Email, Vue.js and Next.js? Would you like to level up with modern CSS? What are new, smart interface design patterns we could use? Let‚Äôs figure it all out together with our [brand new online workshops](https://smashingconf.com/online-workshops/) alongside our free community meetups.
articles.title: New Smashing Front-End & UX Workshops

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: When designing navigation on mobile, we don‚Äôt have to rely on slide-in-menus or nested accordions. We can also use the curtain design pattern, and show multiple levels of navigation at once.
articles.title: Designing The Perfect Mobile Navigation UX

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (William Lyon)
articles.description: If building a GraphQL API backed by a native graph database sounds interesting or at all helpful for the problems you‚Äôre trying to solve as a developer, perhaps you‚Äôd like to give the open-source [Neo4j GraphQL Library](https://srv.buysellads.com/ads/long/x/TCZPLYDDTTTTTTFR6JINCTTTTTTGVUIVKKTTTTTTCT2NTYYTTTTTTI4BVH7U4JBCKQ466IDGV2IUWESGCV7WALL5QYYE) a try. Let‚Äôs take a closer look at the reasons why!
articles.title: Putting The Graph In GraphQL With The Neo4j GraphQL Library

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: November is just around the corner, and with it, a new collection of desktop wallpapers to celebrate the beginning of the month. Designed by creatives from all across the globe, they come in versions with and without a calendar. Let‚Äôs make November colorful!
articles.title: On The Edge Of November (2022 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Yosra Emad)
articles.description: In this article, Yosra Emad explains how to create a rollercoaster path that a ball follows using cubic beziers and CSS transitions. You‚Äôll also learn how the cubic-bezier function in CSS works in detail and how to stack multiple simple animations to create one complex one.
articles.title: How To Create Advanced Animations With CSS

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Yaphi Berhanu)
articles.description: If you've ever wanted to build a web app that you can control with hand gestures as if by magic, this article is for you. With a couple of APIs and some JavaScript, you can build apps that behave like sorcery.
articles.title: Motion Controls In The Browser

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alma Hoffmann)
articles.description: In this article, Alma Hoffmann discusses six basic variables to establish a typographic hierarchy, explains how to look at each differently, and in turn, designs pieces by intentionally modifying each variable to create a typographic hierarchy effectively.
articles.title: Typographic Hierarchies

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Lea Verou)
articles.description: The annual survey for anyone who writes CSS, [State of CSS](https://stateofcss.com/en-us/?source=smashing_magazine_css_survey), is nearing the end of its response period for 2022. The survey is available in many different languages and all questions are optional.
articles.title: State Of CSS Survey: Influence The Future Of CSS

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sacha Greif)
articles.description: In this article, Sacha Greif tries to anticipate future CSS trends and takes a look at some far-fetched and futuristic CSS features that might one day make their way to the browser.
articles.title: Futuristic CSS

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Patrick Brosset)

articles.title: What‚Äôs New In DevTools: Halloween Edition üéÉ

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Meet Understanding Privacy, our brand new Smashing Book to make sense of privacy, and learn how to create inclusive, safe and privacy-aware digital experiences. eBook now available, print shipping in late November.
articles.title: Understanding Privacy: A New Smashing Book Is Here

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nick Sch√§ferhoff)
